mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Walt Disney World® Dolphin Resort Hotel is a 1.4-million-SF hotel and convention complex featuring over 1,500 guest rooms in four projecting nine-story wings, a 57,000-SF ballroom, a 50,000-SF exhibit hall, meeting rooms, restaurants, shops, and recreational facilities. The Dolphin Hotel faces a companion building, the Swan Hotel, across a large crescent-shaped lake spanned by a landscaped pedestrian causeway. Throughout the interiors, MGA utilized colors and details reminiscent of the Florida coast to provide a thematic context consistent with Disney’s program of “entertainment architecture,” which characterized the resort. MGA redesigned the guestrooms in 2004 to meet the needs of contemporary business travelers visiting the extensive convention facilities in both hotels. -- http://www.michaelgraves.com/architecture/project/walt-disney-world-dolphin-resort-hotel.html [work]
